medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient is a 20-year-old man of Indian descent referred for evaluation of new-onset hyperglycemia. His symptoms began after a medical history that includes anxiety, tachycardia, and neonatal hypoglycemia, with a previous treatment of diazoxide tapering off at age 18. Over the past three months, his hemoglobin A1c increased from 6.4% to 6.7%.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Medical history significant for anxiety, tachycardia, and neonatal hypoglycemia. He was treated in the neonatal intensive care unit for hypoglycemia and maintained on diazoxide until age 18.
medical_history.family_history: Father had a history of diabetes diagnosed at age 30, paternal grandfather diagnosed with diabetes at age 28, and mother had gestational diabetes mellitus during pregnancy.
